Good place for breakfast. The food was good. I ordered the #10 breakfast with chocolate chip pancakes based on another review that I read. Sooooo chocolatey and delicious. My boyfriend ordered the same but with banana pancakes. Just an FYI, the chocolate chips and blueberries are cooked into the pancakes, all other options are just toppings, $1.75 extra charge. 

The waitress was friendly, and made sure that we satisfied with our meals. 

The downside of the cafe is the door. For traffic purposes, it would be great if they add another door, just for the flow of traffic. Also, the clearing of tables could be a little more efficient if they hired someone to do that to help the waitresses, bc it is quite busy.

Overall, I would go back. The food is fresh, reasonably priced, and the meals were great and made to order.

hi owner. It will be a good idea to get together with uber that way people can get their food delivered and there will not be so much of a crowd inside the restaurant.That makes it easier for everybody the customer and your staff
the food was excellent and affordable. I will definitely be going back if I'm in the area. our waitress was very nice and helped us on suggestions where to go walk around.

I was so very disappointed with this place I sat there 45 mins before I was greeted and once I was greeted the server was so rude. I'm a server myself so I was trying to be patient put it was ridiculous. The food was good and came out quick but everything else sucked
It's was busy but service was great/prompt. I got their chicken and waffle special. It was really good. Good spot for brunch or nursing a hangover! The home fries were ok.

Local favorite for giant portions of classic breakfast fare with upscale twists like Salmon. 

Seriously best breakfast bang for the buck, nicely executed, great service, coffee always full, during very busy weekend brunch!

Let me start off with this....the food here is bananas! 

Came here for the first time this past Saturday with the fam. Now my wife had ordered from here once before, and kept raving about this spot to me for weeks. Finally broke it down, gave in, and took the short 5 min. drive over. Parking wasn't bad for a busy & beautiful Sat. morning on Baltimore Ave...I know how hectic it can get. We strolled in and waited about 15-20 min. to be seated. It was packed as expected but we came at a good time, so getting a table was no issue.

The waitress and staff here are very gracious and courteous. Very clean space. I ordered the chicken and waffles. That was the first time I've ever had that for breakfast, anywhere. The chicken is very fresh, with the right amount of crispiness on the outside, and tender on the inside. The portions are very generous for the price (I believe it was around $8.00 or so). The waffles were thick and hearty, with just the right amount of butter, just the way Dee likes 'em!

What I really enjoyed the most (aside from the food of course), was the diversity of the customers seated around me, kids, teens, and adults....smiling, laughing and enjoying their meals. I was soaking up that moment, and made me realize how important it is for us as a community to continue going out and supporting our local businesses. Especially the establishments that put out great food and service such as Cedar Park Cafe.

So yeah, I'm a fan, and will most def be back at some point...for lunch!

Later...
Simply place with great customer service and food...you cannot go wrong! I had the chicken and waffles...great!
The food here is to die for and I really enjoyed my Reuben the only reason I gave 4 stars is the fruit flies that were flying around my food while I was eating.

My husband and I picked up cedar park on the way home from a long weekend. It was sooo good. The portions were huge,  everything is homemade. I give it 4 stars only because I've had better breakfast/brunch in the city at places like north 3rd and hawthornes. I reserve 5 stars for meals I don't think I could make myself. But!  Delicious and worth stopping in.

Don't bother going because the service is absolute trash. Not sure what we did to upset the staff, I can only guess it was because we sat at a dirty table (the host told us to seat ourselves), but we sat and waited for over 15 minutes watching people who came in well after us getting menus and service. Another table had to ask their server to help us because we looked so confused and she literally looked at us and shook her head saying it wasn't her table, it was clear she wasn't interested in helping us in the slightest. When I saw the servers audibly arguing about who would get our table, we walked out. I am a server too and I understand if the restaurant is busy, but we were clearly being punished and pushed out of the restaurant by the staff. I'm not going to stick around if the servers have to argue over who gets us and cause a scene making everyone extremely uncomfortable. If you're looking at these reviews to help you decide where to eat, I would recommend Gold Standard down the street or even the food truck in the park.

I love it here. The line gets pretty long on weekends but they have their process figured out and are really efficient about getting people seated, having people pay at the counter so tables clear up faster, etc. The quality is consistent -- I usually get an omelette with homefries and they're always delicious. It's hard to find good diner-type food that isn't trying to be fancy and Cedar Park has just that.

I came around noon on a weekday, so there wasn't a wait. This cafe is in a pleasant location. Beautiful trees are waving outside. Unfortunately my sis and I couldn't get the window seats, but it was still nice to watch nonetheless.

In terms of the food and service, I would say they were just OK. The server we had was good, adequate enough. She was standing off to the side not really paying attention when we asked for her to take our check, but this is nothing against her character. Could she have been more alert-- yeah. Could she have been bubblier, yes probably. But she was good.

The food I had was nothing incredible really. I used to live in Southwest Philly, and Woodland Village makes similar food, for cheaper. I think their platters are $4, in fact. The venue isn't as nice or as clean, but the food is comparable to here.  So of course it was a little disappointing to have eggs, sausage links and a waffle that tasted like something I could make myself at home or get at Woodland Village for around $8. For all that, I may as well have paid an extra few dollars and gone to Sabrina's and had one of their breakfast concoctions.

I finished all my food. I enjoyed the time of day and the atmosphere. I just wasn't amazed by what I had for breakfast. Maybe I'll go back for the Chicken and Waffles?

Tried this spot out on Sunday for breakfast an the place was packed.. Standby room only had to wait a few mins to be seated. Our waitress came an sat us down and took our order.. I wish she would have told us her name so I cld put it in my review cause she was awesome. I can describe her as dark skin and fairly slim.. Anyways she made my coffee perfectly both times. I ordered the fish and grits an boyfriend ordered eggs, hash browns, turkey sausage. I thought the fish could have been alittle bigger but it actually was just enough to fill me up an not make me uncomfortable. When we left the line was out the door.. This place is well liked, and frequented by all which I loved.. The prices were fair! Will go back

This place has live roaches! Do not eat there!  I stopped in to dine with my boyfriend for lunch and noticed live roaches at the entrance next to the ATM machine.  Roaches were also crawling on the ATM machine which is located next to the garbage.  We left immediately.  I will not eat here.  I hope that Food Safety Sanitation will inspect this place to ensure that it is up to code.

I haven't order anything bad here yet. The wait service is not bad it's the kitchen that's slow waited a good amount of time before my food came out the place wasn't busy like it usually is oh well the food good just gotta pack your patient.
My go-to weekend breakfast spot. Great menu all around. Their omelettes, fried chicken, and hotcakes are great!
Everyone is wearing their coats in here. I asked the cashier about turning up the heat and he said the heat is on but it takes a while to turn up. The place has already been open for a few hours!

What a treat. Great food at the right price. One time was given Ham instead of Pork Roll but I think it was my fault because I asked for "Taylor Ham" which is a North Jersey translation of "Taylor Pork Roll" as it's more commonly referred to in South Jersey/Philly (as I understand). Once I dropped my eggs on the floor and they offered to bring me new ones. French toast is a bit too buttery. Flapjacks are 10/10. Very post-church vibe on Sundays in a good way. Great location, sometimes the kitchen is slow but the servers are very communicative about it and they're all doing their best ! Definitely recommend for a low-key morning bite.
Probably the best french toast I've had in a very long time! Definitely worth the try.

They seated us next to the kitchen, because the front half of the restaurant (with the only windows) is "closed" after about 1:30 pm. We were surrounded by dirty dishes at other tables throughout the meal. They didn't drain the bacon. I had to beg for a second cup of coffee. The waffles and chicken were still good. They need to think about the experience from the customers' point of view.

Heard so much about Cedar Park's chicken and waffles, so of course, I had to try it out.  I came with a friend and both decided to go with their famous plate (instead of getting two different items and sharing like I would normally do). Reading the raving reviews, I really thought that this dish would be spectacular, but unfortunately, was very disappointed.  

In terms of service, we came here on a Sunday around noon. It was quite busy and we probably didn't get seated until after 25 minutes waiting in line.  Even after seating, the service was slow.  We waited for 15 minutes just to pay our bill because our server just never came back (this was after the brunch crowd slowed down significantly).  

As for food? Well, either my expectations were too high or they just experienced a very bad day. The waffle was dry and too cakey.  And the two pieces of breaded chicken (albeit crispy and had some decent flavors) was not tender nor moist. I understand that eateries have good and bad days, but based on both food and service, it'd probably be a while before I would give Cedar Park Cafe another try.

This was my first time in Cedar Park, and naturally my friend and I were looking for a brunch place. This place caught our eye because it was so close. We were immediately seated but we quickly realized this was a super popular joint. And soon we realized why.

 The portions are enormous and delicious. I got #8 with Turkey Bacon and sausage patty. It also came with savory grits, toast, amazing home fries (seriously, the place is worth it just for the home fries), and 2 eggs. Needless to say, I was stuffed. Everything was great and reasonably priced. 

Highly recommended.
Good food but can be a little slow. Must repeat order because sometimes there have forgot what was wanted on order, but the food is good.
I love their breakfast: Pork Sausage patties, Homefries, Cheese Eggs, Wheat Toast w/ butter .. Off the hook!!

I love this place but I feel like it's gone downhill. I routinely have to ask servers twice or three times for things. Their butter is stale and tastes like it's absorbed the odors from The interiors of their walk-in fridge, their coffee is hit or miss, their bathrooms are gendered and dirty and dingy looking, the menu prices are awesome but you have to know how to order everything, for instants I find myself having to order waffles, home fries, corn beef hash, everything except for french fries well done. The cooks rush and don't even cook their pancakes and waffles until they're just done, they are never crispy.

This place is right down the block from where I get my haircut and I try to stop in when I can for one of my favorite meals...Chicken and Waffles!!   It's so good here, and at a very fair price!   The chicken is a little spicy, but paired with the sweet waffle and maple syrup, it's pure perfection.   I stopped in this morning with my daughters, since they were off from school.   I knew the portions were on the large size, so we ordered two plates, to share between the 3 of us and we even had leftovers!

We ordered the Chicken and Waffles, and a plate of creamed chipped beef.   The chipped beef on toast comes with 2 eggs, any style and grits or hash browns.   One of my girls wanted a side of bacon, too, so we had that, as well.  The service was friendly and efficient and the food came out quite quickly.   Both of my girls liked the chicken and waffles and they devoured the chipped beef plate.    

I'll definitely return when I'm in the area.  Credit Cards only over $10 bill.

My family have been coming here for many years. The last two have been spotty. The prior waitress was good, these waitress, cooks and manager is HORRIBLE. We decided to put this place in the don't patronize list.  Slow service and cold food don't add up.

Every time I eat here, there's a line out the door. But the food is worth the wait. Specifically, the chicken and waffles are worth the wait. I love the panko-breading on the chicken, unique but tasty, and not too greasy. I keep meaning to try their other fare, but the pull of the chicken and waffles are too much :)

Clean. Family friendly. Generous portions at a good price. And good coffee too!

Busy diner like restaurant that has by far the best chicken and waffles ever.  The rest of there breakfast menu is pretty basic and could be had anywhere but I would certainly trek out to West Philly again for the chicken and waffle dish.  A warning about their staff though is that the younger ones seem to really not care.  The young woman we had needed to be reminded of drinks we had ordered and begged for coffee refills. I even had to wait for a check with piled up dirty dishes in front me for 15 minutes.  Thank goodness their food was good because the service I received certainly wouldn't bring me back.

Worth the wait on a Sunday! The staff is very accommodating and extra nice! I had the fish and grits it was seasoned well and the portions were good. I couldn't finish it! Seating is first come first serve. It's worth it.

Came here for late brunch and was seated promptly. I got the chicken and waffles while my boyfriend got French toast with French fries. French toast was pretty good but a little soggy for my tastes. Chicken was pretty good although it wasn't quite what I was expecting. They are more like fried chicken cutlets with a bit of a kick (some red pepper seasoning probably). The sweet and sour sauce was different even though my boyfriend was not a fan. The waffle was okay; a bit too cakey and dense for me. But for this price it was a good deal and I'd go back and try other things!

Their home fries are  absolutely delicious.
They got a good vibe here and feels real welcoming on a cold Sunday morning.
Get the healthy egg white omelette with a side of homefries.

Oh my gawd! The food was amazeball! I had the chicken and waffle and it was heavenly! The chicken had a sweetheat kick to it with a sweet dipping sauce on the side. the waffle was freshly prepared! It came out quickly, the cost was awesome and the service was good! I'm def visiting every time I come to philly! Nice!!!!!!

Nova lox omelette with home fries is a deal and a half and sooo delicious. Perfectly cooked eggs. Creamy potatoes, crispy in the outside. Chicken and waffles an even better deal. Perfectly seasoned and cooked chicken and fluffy waffle served with pepper jelly. Came from out of town but best believe this would be a regular spot. Waitstaff very kind. Would recommends to anyone. Thank you!!

Last Sunday my roommate asked if I wanted to go get brunch.  Why not said I.  Where should we go?  Que my cousin, the semi-retired chef's, Facebook status:  "Corned been hash with poached eggs!"  I asked where? and she told me Cedar Park Cafe.

Man, were we ever glad we went!  The place is not much to look at but who cares?  It is a true "greasy spoon" as far as looks go. And you might have a wee bit of a wait, but it is well worth it.

I ordered corned beef hash, crisp with poached eggs, grits (!), and rye toast.  The hash was perfect, and the grits were the best I have had outside of the Dirty South. I was Soooo delighted and then I got to the eggs.  Uh oh!  The yolks were solid!  That's not gonna work with corned beef hash!

We got the server's attention, but she was busy with other customers.  So another server who saw that something seemed off, sent a line cook (!) over. I assured him that everything else was great and that I did not want a new plate of food, just some new eggs.  All he asked was how I wanted the eggs (I just need soft yolks and cooked whites at this stage, was my answer) and off he went.  In about 5 minutes or so I had my eggs perfectly done, served by the line cook himself. Our server came over to make sure it all worked out well and I thanked her for the great service. Heck,I have had worse service in an allegedly 5 star restaurant in NYC!  

You may wonder why 5 stars if my eggs were done wrong.  Well, they earned the full 5 because they handled it so efficiently and without fuss or excuses.  Poached eggs can get overcooked very easily; I won't hold that against them.

Now, here is the best part of all.  Guess how much bruch for two was *with* a 20+% tip?  Go on, guess!  

$21.00

I will definitely eat here again!!  In fact, I would eat here with a hangover!!

Clean, well furnished in modern style place. Service is wonderful provided by well-mannered waitresses. I had a uncommon battered chicken and waffle for my breakfast. The chicken was fried after order was made so it was hot and juicy. Waffle was ok tough. Nothing fancy about it. I am definitely going there again to explore more menu.

This place is one of the best finds in West Philly. I walked in for an early breakfast (they open at 7) and saw that they had a fair amount of people in there eating at the tables and also at the diner counter. I was told that I could sit anywhere and someone would assist me. I chose a nice seat by the window and was promptly presented with a menu from which I ordered the platter consisting of french toast or pancakes, sausage or bacon, eggs and home fries (all for 8.00!). I added sliced wheat toast for an extra .75. The food came within the next 10 minutes! They are fast at this place. I even went today and same thing! 

Now on to the food:

French toast:Phenomenal. Three huge, fluffy and buttery slices. Add syrup and it was a golden river of pure deliciousness flowing down my plate.

Vegetable home fries: Hearty portion that had plenty of vegetables (mushrooms, peppers, onions, tomatoes and spinach). My favorite part of my breakfast (though I struggled choosing since the French toast was also the best I've ever had).

Bacon: 4 Long and meaty strips, not those short thin strips you get everywhere else. 

Eggs: Fluffy and tasty! 

The service in this place is also wonderful. Everyone seems to be in good spirits and are so polite and attentive. It is such a comfortable environment to dine in and with the prices, you get more than you pay for here!

I can see very easily why people in the neighborhood really like Cedar Park Cafe. Their menu of diner-style comfort food is just exactly what you need on a chilly weekend or an early weekday morning. I got the California omelette with home fries, which was a darn big plate of food, even without the toast (which I passed on.) The ingredients seemed fresh, although the food definitely under-seasoned. We had a wait a while for coffee, and all of the juices are bottled. Service was extremely friendly & fast otherwise. I definitely would vote that you give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood.

This place is amazing. Ive been here almost ten times within three weeks. They have great food at an inexpensive price. You have got to try their hot beef sausage and french toast its my favorite. They do get very packed very fast though and they don't take reservations.

Came here with the family when visiting he annoying little sister at UPenn. Food was delicious!!!  I had the lox omelet (nova lox, capers, spinach, & red onions) and I added provolone cheese. It came with home fries (potatoes with red and green peppers and red onions) and my choice of toast (I chose potato bread). I also had a side of beef bacon......yup! Beef bacon!!  And a side of sliced avocado. My kids, who are extremely picky about eating in "urban" restaurants, totally enjoyed their meals (child 1: steak, eggs, french fries. Child 2: pancakes, eggs, beef bacon, and french fries). The mister, who is close to impossible to please, had grits, corned beef hash, eggs, and potato bread and even he was satisfied!  All in all, we really enjoyed ourselves and I would def recommend it to anyone willing to take the 5min drive, in the other direction.

When my friends and I arrived, there was a little bit of a wait to be seated but it was good we got there when we did because after being seated, the line was longer. The decor of the place is no frills and very casual/chill. 

I decided on the classic chicken and waffles. The meal came with 2 thickly crusted fried chicken tenders which I loved and was happy I didn't have to deal with bones. The chicken was incredibly well seasoned, tender, crispy and yummy! The waffle was covered in butter and powdered sugar. I wasn't a huge fan of the waffle- It was kind of bland. I ate the waffle with the chicken but couldn't really discern the waffle taste. It was also not as crispy as I would have liked. Also on the plate, there was sweet chili sauce on the side which actually went really well with the chicken. 

My friend ordered some chocolate chip hotcakes (pancakes), which I got to try and MAN, they were delicious! There were tons of chocolate chips and powdered sugar sprinkled on top of the pancakes as well as a dab of butter. It was very chocolate-y, the way I like my chocolate chip pancakes to be and the chocolate just melted in my mouth. The hotcakes themselves were also great- Fluffy, warm and full of buttery goodness. 

I also got to try some of my friend's hashbrowns which were so good! They were perfectly crunchy and the potatoes were flavorful. 

Service was decent and the pricing was very reasonable. I believe every meal on the menu was under $10.

we came here based on a recommendation.  we arrived and got seated pretty fast.  it took about 10 minutes before anyone even took our order. and she was rushing us through the order taking process so fast that my gf didn't even get to finish talking before she started to ask me what i wanted.  once the order got put in, it took about 30 minutes before the food came out.  i got the eggs Benedict, which was trash.  it was missing one full egg and was only egg white on muffin and the other egg was way over cooked.  and then had the most amount sauce that any Benedict should have.  no one ever came to check on us and see how the food is/was, no one came to ask if we needed refills, which we did.

once we were done eating we stacked our plates neatly and waited and waited and waited a little more for our check.  nothing.  got looked over and walked past multiple times. finally our server came back after what was probably her break sipping her drink and asked if we were ready for our check.  hrmm what ever gave you that idea?  that service was hands down the worst I've ever had in a very long time.

This place was a yelp suggestion and boy was it a great one!!!  First of all, the place is RIGHT around the corner from my house and secondly the food is amazing!!! 

I got the chicken and waffles and although it was a fried split chicken breast and not the traditional southern fried wings didn't make any difference at all. The chicken was seasoned to perfection, the perfect amount of spicy and tangy. And who can really mess up on a waffle!  All in all the food was absolutely amazing and I will be returning again and again and again!

Pretty good spot! We followed the Yelp reviews on our brief trip to Philly and it was well served. I had the chicken and waffles...tasty and I loved how crispy the chicken was. Only downside is they don't have a kids menu...but the waiter did accommodate us!

The only good dish here is chicken and waffles. DO NOT ADD CHEESE to your omelette or grits. Their cheese is so nasty and plastic. It completely ruined the grits and omelette. The vibe of the place is food kitchen with a touch of local breakfast spot. It's very informal place, after you are done eating don't wait for the bill just pay at the cashier. It's more pricey than I thought. I assumed it was a black owned business bc the servers are black but I'm pretty sure it's Asian owned, a side note. the chicken for the waffle is good and seasoned.

I eat here all the time! I grew up eating this kind of food. I've never ordered anything and been disappointed. It's so easy to customize your food because they don't require you to stick to a certain platter. It has a clean environment, a well mannered staff, and an affordable price. Overall, I would suggest giving Cedar Park Café a visit if you're in the area and looking for a great breakfast and/or lunch.

Price:
Decent for what you get! Spent about $10 dollars getting a good sized brunch (2 meats, 2 eggs, toast, home fries, and grits) or eggs Benedict with home fries.

Food quality/quantity:
Home style cooking with home style taste. Portion sizes are generous. Giving this place a four star because quality is above average but lacking some flavor IMO overall but with all the condiments they give you can potentially make up for it.

Service:
Waiters are generally friendly and attentive. Place to go if you're looking to satisfy that brunch craving!

Don't Judge a Book by its cover!

Had breakfast here with my son and while the place looks a little rough when you walk in, the food and service were really good. 

Seat yourself type setup with a decent number of tables and room...you don't feel cramped here. 

Waitress was prompt, nice, and attentive but the menus were a bit beat up and messy. You have to read the menu carefully because some menu items have lots of included sides (yeah). I went with the Chicken & Waffles w/ blueberries and a side of Canadian bacon (I took a pic but somehow lost it) and my son had the Western Omelette. Big portions were large and the omelette came toast, home fries, and a drink. 

The food was tasty, better than I expected when I first walked in. The waffle came with the blueberries on top, usually a BIG no-no for me (cook the waffle with the fruit inside to release the flavors..please) but the berries were tasty anyway. The also served it with some sweet chile sauce for the chicken, not bad but there is something good about fired chicken with maple syrup . The omelette and portion of home fries were HUGE, too much to finish in one sitting.

Overall not a bad place to eat, and I would go back if I were in the area. More of a good "greasy spoon" than a cafe' or diner. If they cleaned up a little, I would give them 4 stars.

This place is my favorite brunch place in all of Philadelphia. I think the only place that comes close is Green Eggs Cafe. The food is affordable (all platters are under $10), delicious, and giant in portions. I've come here a lot when I lived on Baltimore, but I'll take the walk to eat here. I love their corn beef hash, and regular "choose your breakfast meat" platter. The only issue is the line on Sundays. Their system is basically first-come-first-serve. It's always shooting out the door, just wish they had some chairs outside or something.

Lovely place for breakfast. Got here around 9 am on Sunday and there was no wait!
I ordered the veggie omelette with fries and potato bread on the side (which pretty much tastes like white bread) and a side of much needed hot chocolate which was delicious on that chilly morning.
My date had the pancakes with walnuts and topped them off w syrup which was to die for! I love that you can pick a meat, a sweet dish, and coffee on the side. Great food, great prices!

The food was awesome. I called to order and my food was ready within 15 minutes. We had chicken and waffles and home fries, scrambled eggs, scrapple and toast. Everything was good. My husband and I were so full and satisfied. We will definitely be ordering or dining in again.

I'll just get this out of the way that I am a huuuuuuge fan of Cedar Park cafe. Located on 49 and Baltimore, this little diner is a gem. My friends and I came on a Saturday for brunch and there was a ~15 min wait to have the three of us seated.

I ordered the #10 which came with 2 eggs, my choice of a sausage, and pancakes. While there is nothing special about the food here, I will say that it is the most reasonable brunch spot. I love being able to come out to ture West Philadelphia and be surrounded by the residents of the neighborhood compared to the university setting. There is a vibe at Cedar Park cafe that is unrivaled and oozes with a sense of community.

While there are better quality brunch places in U-City, Cedar Park cafe has my heart as well as my stomach.

10/10 nothin else.

Cheap, tasty ,fast, not over crowded or loud, Has corn beef hash, nice location right by the parklet and bmore ave.  Pretty much everything you want in a breakfast place with plenty of seats.  Stop in!
The Veggie Hash 2as delicious.  Portion sizes are great and service is super friendly.  Will definitely be back!
I had the chicken and waffle and the waffle was nice and fluffy, but the chicken was gross. They should change their recipe. Highly disappointed
Love Cedar Park Cafe! The chicken and waffles are the best and I always leaving feeling pleasantly stuffed. (Also it's not too hard on your wallet either!)

Best breakfast in Philly. Superb waitresses and awesome food. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal at a reasonable price. It's a little out of the way but well worth the trip

Great place for breakfast! The food here is ridiculously amazing and cheap. My favorite is the chicken and waffles. I knocked a star off because of the cleanliness of the place. The tables are always sticky even though I've been here numerous times.
Still a go-to spot 6 years later. Love that they have chicken cheese steaks since I don't eat beef. It can get a bit busy during peak hours but they're quick and easy to order from.

Cedar Park Cafe is the epitome of West Philly - comfortable, friendly, and chill. This diner feels homey and welcoming, especially with its friendly staff. The service here is amazing - I'm not sure what her name is but one of the waitresses has amazing memory and can remember your order to the dot without jotting a thing.

I got the chicken and waffles and it was so good! The portions are quite big and great for its price. As for the flavor, the chicken is nice and crisp and tastes even better with the complementary sweet chili sauce that is on the side. I also always enjoy the bottomless coffee here. Just another reminder that this place is no frills but just strictly amazing food. Would recommend for a brunch out at west Philly.

First time I visited this morning and had turkey sausage, eggs, pancakes, homefries and grits. The food was pretty good. It was not fall out my chair delicious cause the grits were bland. 

Its was okayyyy...I wouldn't wait in line for the food though

I have been coming here for years!  I normally order some oatmeal and a coffee.  I wanted to make an order for pick up and I was 20 minutes away.  I spoke to the Asian female manager who was EXTREMELY rude and disrespectful.  She told me that she could not take my order because they had just opened and no one was there and that when I got there the food would not be done.  She didn't even know that I was coming from across town.  She simply assumed that I was around the corner.  I asked to speak to someone else and she said "who you wanna speak to the cook!"  I was sooo upset I went there anyway (that's how I found out that the person i spoke to was an Asian female)  I went to the counter and she was just as rude in person!  She pointed to a sign that said that she did not have to serve me!  I said I did not come to be served food.  Why would I order from someone who is rude and disrespectful!  I am an educator by profession and I am writing this in Hope's of getting the attention of the owner of the facility so that I can be addressed properly.

I love this place for breakfast and lunch. The staff is great and Nina is the best. I usually order take out and the wait os is never long. The food is always delicious and the prices are a good value. It is a great neighborhood restaurant.
I LOVE cedar park Cafe for casual breakfast! They even know how to make grits and I always get those (add lots of butter, salt, & pepper!) with the nova lox omelet!

I've been dying to eat here for months and when I finally got the opportunity to, I wasn't really pleased.
To begin with, the lines were out the door. Luckily we've only been waiting for 15minutes or so. They need a host by the door to seat people because things were getting hectic. Anyways, service was kind of slow. I understand the server was backed up but it took her a while to get us drinks/take our orders. 
The food came out very fast. I asked for my eggs well done but instead it was cold and wasn't cooked well. Everything else was okay. This place reminds me of IHOP. I'm glad I gave this place a try, but there are definitely other places in the area that's better.

I've been to this cafe a couple of times. It's definitely your typical neighborhood diner with all the standard breakfast dishes. The food is homey, good, and affordable. Also, the service is what I would consider decent. So on that note, if you live in or are visiting Cedar Park this place will and should be a place you frequent, regardless of what I I'm going to say next lol.

The wait is soooooooooo long on the weekends, but it's for those points I made above. Again, this is clearly the neighborhood spot so on the weekends everyone and their auntie, cousin, daddy, and nephew are here. My suggestion to you is to get up early on the weekend or just be prepared for a wait.

Overall, this is a good diner type cafe. We always enjoy our breakfast here! The docked star is for the wait and because it's not the most delicious breakfast I've ever had, but definitely good and very filling.

Oh they also are cash only. There is an ATM by the door.

One of the Best places in this west Philly area (we have many) this place has been around for a very long time and have always been on top of their game! Been around longer than the yelp app itself and I'm a yelper so decided to send out a review if u are new to the area and want to go to a nice good atmosphere sit down cafe with great prices this will be your go to ! Also they have a vegan friendly menu! As well

I have been here a couple times for breakfast and it is soooooo nice to have a real 'breakfast' restaurant in my neighborhood. The restaurant is open 7 days a week 7 am - 3pm. The service is speedy and everyone is really nice. Good prices! Vegetarian choices. They have breakfast sandwiches and several platters. Also, serves lunch. Lunch platters and Hoagies. 

Both times I have gottena breakfast platter. They will add cheese for .30 extra and green peppers and onions to the home fries for .30. I brought a friend my second time and she agreed, it was really good. We will bring more people.

Good deals, clean and friendly. welcome to our neighborhood.
Love it! great food, service, and clientele.  One of the few places that is good Southern food and has a truly mixed race clientele .

I haven't been here for about a year and wow did this place exceed my expectations! I already knew the chicken and waffles were good but this time it was absolutely amazing. The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. It also might just be me but I think the chicken size is bigger! The price is still very much affordable and the service is decent. The place gets really crowded on a weekend so plan accordingly. I usually like going on a weekday to avoid the crowds.

This could have been a 5 star rating however in the middle of enjoying my very delicious meal... a four legged friend decided to join me and my husband for breakfast  We called our waitress over and she quickly told who I'm assuming is one of the bosses? The boss kindly walked over and smashed our friend on the wall and walked away ‍ We immediately asked for the check, was charged and paid full price. I tipped and thanked the waitress and gave her my fair well because sadly...we will never return
Nothing spectacular about this place. The food is subpar and cheap. Customer service is okay. Good place to go if you want a full breakfast but don't want to pay big bucks

The most ridiculous service I've ever seen, after waiting for 20 minutes no one seated us, and when we went to the front desk, the lady sent us back to the door. After another 5 minutes we decided to leave. The funny thing was that there were no one waiting to be seated ahead of us. And when you tell them, they just ignore you, waiters walk by staring at you and ignoring that you are waiting for long.
If you live in West Philly definitely go to Cedar Park you will not be disappointed. The weekends are crowded so be warn you may be standing in line for a table

Amazing food. Great service. I had the veggie sandwich with homefries. Friend had the salmon with cream cheese on a bagel. Other friend had veggie omelette. Everything was perfection and great priced! Very clean and tidy area. Will definitely come here again!
Really like it here - food is good, affordable, and both the food and service are solid and consistent. Love the veggie omelet and French fries!

Went here after reading reviews on Yelp. Went there as a party of 4 for breakfast. It was everything the reviews said it was. Ordered chicken and waffle - Great! We also ordered Eggs Benedict, omelet, and the hash browns. Huge portions, great taste, and worth every penny of the very reasonable prices that won't break your bank account. We will be back - soon!

Something has gone horribly wrong at the CPC. We used to be regulars, every week for breakfast, but a few months ago, something changed. The service, which had been brisk, efficient and friendly, became inattentive and lackadaisical. The food which had always been generous, well cooked and tasty, became skimpy and poorly presented. 
Today, we decided to try our old favorite again. When we came in there were many empty tables, but it took a minute for someone to acknowledge us and allow us to be seated. 
We sat at our table, without menus for five minutes, while several wait staff walked in circles around the restaurant. A pair was seated to our right and one waiter, gave them menus, and came back to take their drink order and then brought them their drinks. 
We still waited to even be given menus. My husband finally went to the front and got us menus. We still had not been addressed.
At 15 minutes of waiting for ANY kind of service we left. 
So sad, we really used to love to see our regular super friendly and fast waiters and eat and inexpensive quick breakfast, but no more. 
CPC, get it together and hire a decent waitstaff again!

I went with some friends for breakfast this past Sunday. I liked the breakfast I ordered, scrambled eggs with sausage and home fries.  I had to call over the waitress to get a menu and take our order, but once that happened we were served promptly.

It is a small place and was busy on Sunday morning.  I'd go back again.

Breakfast was great.  Nice quaint, clean spot, service was good and food was great.  They have a good menu and good location.  

I wish I could give it 3.5 stars but I can't, only whole numbers here!

I didn't give it four only because I specifically asked for spinach in my great tasting omelet and there was none and not once did the waitress/server come and ask how our meal was so I never really got a chance to tell her.  I was going to flag her down but hubby told me not to, so I obliged because the food was so good... besides who sends the food back.

I would surely revisit again and this time get spinach in my omelet.  Hubby and daughter had french toast which was delish, and their homefries are banging!!!

I had a delicious breakfast on a busy weekday morning. The food was good, especially the waffle. Coffee was good. It was very busy for the time of the morning. I will definitely be back if I am in the neighborhood again.

Too bomb! I've been looking for a breakfast spot in Philly for a minute and I think I've found the best one. Everything was good, the waffle was a little to thick for my liking and lacked taste but it could've been because it was to-go (I noticed pancakes and waffle are best when fresh off the pan). The veggies home fries is my new fav and the eggs were cooked exactly how I wanted. Will definitely be back!

Five. Star. Situation. Philadelphia is fortunate to have such a well-run, top-of-the-line service, and delicious food. 

Service:
There was a short wait when we came early (8:45/9am). We needed seating for 7, and were informed we'd need to split up. To our surprise, she made space for us and was very attentive to everything we needed for a great meal experience.

What an absolutely wonderful spot. If you're looking for a classic breakfast joint this is it. Service is consistently friendly and helpful, the food is reliably great, and it's incredibly reasonably priced. I've been here several times now (I recommend the waffles) and it's fantastic.

Stopped in today to grab breakfast with the hubby, this is out second time having breakfast here but first time eating in. The service was very slow, I mean slooow. We were told to find a seat anywhere it was empty and once we did it took at least 15 min to get acknowledged. We asked for OJ and a Ice tea that took an additional 10min and we still didn't have menus. Once we got out menus we immediately placed our orders and began to wait..... it took almost 45 min to get our food and get this not everything came out on time!  Our server was not attentive at all, she forgot several things we asked for. She never asked were we okay, or how we was doing. The food is good, but the service is horrible. They should either hire a hostess, manager, or more servers. And the young man cleaning the tables was wiping each table with the same tag and not thoroughly cleaning them. I won't be returning in the future though.

All I am going to say is: chicken and waffles. I am sure other food on the menu is amazing, but where else can you get a generous portion of chicken and waffles for $8.75? Dine in service is efficient! I have not done take out here.

We've been here three times in the last week and couldn't be happier to have moved into a neighborhood with such a great, cheap breakfast place that opens early. The portions are large and the food comes out quickly. The inside is clean and the wait staff is always nice. Coffee refills come frequently as well. We will be eating here a ton!

Mrs Hillary Clinton literally came to Cedar Park Cafe and took a picture with me and my dining friends!!! What an amazing experience!! I never been soo excited to share this moment with my fellow Yelpers and write a review!

So we knew nothing about this moment, this was just a typical Brunch Chronicles day where me and my co workers select a place to have brunch. So I randomly choose the Cedar Park Cafe and obviously Mrs Clinton did too lol!!

Cedar Park Cafe is a community gem! It offers friendly staff, fast seating, delicious brunch and a opportunity to dine in a diverse setting! 

I ordered the meat lovers omelette, grits, and whole wheat toast which was all delicious!! Towards the end of our dining we saw these men in suits looking serious scooping out the restaurant we was then told not to leave until the guest arrived, however we had no idea who it was then low and behold Mrs Clinton walks in she was friendly and shook everyone hands!!

Cedar Park Cafe not only do you offer delicious food but you will now go in history as being apart of the 2016 election!!

Super solid breakfast/brunch at an incredible value! I dined here a few years ago and recently ordered breakfast for 2 adults and 2 teen boys. Everything was delicious and plentiful. I LOVE the veggie home fries, they're full of veg & perfectly cooked potatoes. You do have to season them because I taste almost none but man salt, pepper and a dash of sazon wakes it all up. There was enough food for 4 and we were stuffed at $35 it was a steal. Everyone was satisfied, place is solid! Give it a try.

This place is great for what it is -- a no-frills diner with good, cheap food.  From the clientele it looks like everyone in the neighborhood feels welcome.   Waitstaff has been a little ditzy every time we've been, but always very friendly and helpful.  This place fills a need we have and it does it well.  I hope they're in business a long, long time.

This place is a fantastic little breakfast place. I would not call it a "brunch" spot since the menu options, outside the chicken and waffles, are pretty basic. BUT the chicken and waffles at this place are insanely delicious!!

I've have my fair share of fried chicken in the south, and this chicken was something special - not exactly better - but a different flavor, and a very tasty flavor at that. And for $7.99 what an extraordinary deal. My one gripe is that this place loads the butter directly onto the waffles and its a LOT of butter - so I guess my advice would be to ask for less when ordering or ask for it on the side.

I also think there is a $10 credit card minimum, helpful to know.

This cafe is local favorite and offers basic comfort food. The chicken and waffles is definitely the most popular dish here and you get a decent amount of food for the price. I ordered the French toast, sausage, and egg and it tasted great as well. 

The restaurant gets packed especially during brunch hours and the service can be really slow. The waitress I had was very kind and courteous, but I saw other customers wait a very long time for the tables to be cleaned and for them to be seated. The restaurant has great food, but the service could be improved.

I was there yesterday . It was very cold inside! The food was not that good ! I hate that they put the butter on ur food for you instead of you do in ur self! This is cost saving but customer losing! How do u know how much I want??? Why do u charge for refills on coffee?? Do you give the customers any reason to come back?

Generous portions
Fair prices
Tasty food

Cedar Park is casual, comfortable, and convivial. I've been on two separate occasions for breakfast - once with a friend, and once with my kids. Each time, everyone left stuffed, satisfied, and happy. 

The menu runs a good gamut from basic eggs, hot cakes, and bacon to creamed chipped beef on toast points (a personal favorite). There are even pork, beef, OR turkey scrapple offerings. For a tidy little breakfast, expect to pay ~$7, and maybe $12 per person for more sides and fixin's.  (Note that credit/debit cards can only be used on checks of $10+.)  Juices are the bottled kind, and the coffee's fine. Service has been friendly and courteous, timely and arm's length. 

This is a recommended breakfast haunt if in the vicinity (or looking for some good scrapple variety!). 

Recommended.

Went here for breakfast and the food was not great. I was served a cold Belgium waffle, lukewarm sausages and home fries. Informed my waitress the waffle was cold, she took it, and returned with the same waffle that was heated mostly likely in the microwave. The only good part of my breakfast was the iced tea. I will definitely not be returning.

Great food, friendly service!

I went there this week with my girlfriend to grab some brunch.  We wanted to try something different from our usual eyehop (sic).  

We walked in and were told to sit wherever we wanted, a server came to us immediately, she was friendly; she got our drinks and took our orders.  The food came out quick and tasted DELICIOUS.

I like that they had many options for people who do not eat pork (many restaurants under-estimate just how many of us non-pork eaters there are out there).

It sounds weird, but I am impressed with the fact that we got our food right away.  In 90% of restaurants I've been to, there is an inexplicably large gap in time between our order ticket being submitted and my food getting to me.

 My one issue (which is very minor) is I wish the server asked how we found the meal during the half-way point, which is standard practice. But other than that, this place is great.

I would definitely recommend it!
This is hands down the best cafe in town. They have great servers, easy menu, delicious choices & the best chicken and waffles for $8! Love it!

loved the chicken and waffles here! the chicken is perfectly seasoned with a little bit of spice in the breading and the waffle comes with several pats of butter and a dusting of powdered sugar - such a treat! douse that baby with maple syrup and enjoy.

I'm a classy woman and sometimes classy women want to have Eggs Benedict for lunch with Veggie Homefries. Cedar Park Diner appeals to the classic grubber in all of us. When I meet friends here for brunch I feel like things are going well in life. I'm eating good food in a beautifully renovated Cedar Park space. The food is perfect. The waitress is nice. The water has lemons. The patrons are happy. Life is going well. The special thing is the diner makes the whole neighborhood look like life is going well.
Best chicken and waffles ever! Also try their dankwich!  Great service and consistently delicious food! Highly recommended!

This place was simply delicious! There was a wait when we arrived but it didn't take very long to get a table. People willing to wait outside to eat is usually a good sign and it definitely was here! I got the Benedict with veggie hash browns. It's like $1.75 to add veggies to your hash browns  but it is so worth it! The service was great, everyone was efficient. It was so good that I had to compliment the servers to the owner. I would definitely come back, in fact- if I lived here, this would be my regular spot!
We walked in around 1pm on a Saturday and we were immediately seated. The waitress was friendly and the food came fast.
This is my go to spot for a quick and warm meal. I love getting their pancakes and their turkey bacon.

Been in philly for three days with my wife and best friend for made in America and have been raging super hard so we came to this place to recharge. After long but well worth the wait dilemma of which foods to eat it was decided I was getting a #9 with onions and mushrooms bc you know shoot your shot. Anyways this place is great they should be looking for investors to expand and remodel don't be scared of growth. Great service very polite
One of my favorite brunch places out this way. Large portions at a very reasonable price.

I've walked past Cedar Park Cafe a million times and had never made my way inside - until a few weeks ago on a snow Saturday morning.

What a wonderful, neighborhood spot. Extremely affordable with huge portions - it's reminiscent of a family diner, but plucked down across from Cedar Park in west philly.

Upon my first visit, I went for a classic - just 2 eggs (over easy), some crispy scrapple, 2 pancakes, and grits. Everything was as it should be - messy, delicious, and greasy (in the best way.)

My partner got the Chicken & Waffles and I was super jealous - the chicken was extremely crispy, and the waffle was perfect.

Really can't wait to come back... :)

For the price, it's the best breakfast option in the neighborhood. There's usually a wait but the line moves quickly. I've never had anything besides breakfast food but it's awesome. My girlfriend and I usually split the corned beef hash and the fried chicken/waffle. I believe the fried chicken is around $8 and it's incredible for that price. I've had fried chicken at other restaurants in the area for double the price and it hasn't been as good as Cedar Park. Go get this chicken.

Ordered a take out burger. They said it would take 10 minutes. It ended up taking 45 minutes. The burger was over done and there were literally 5 fries. There was no apology or effort to make up for there shit service. Never going back.

I've never been to a place with worse customer service. Waited in line for an hour for a table meanwhile there was at least 6 open tables that just needed to be cleared off. After asking about it, I was told they were closing off the back even though there was about 3 groups waiting to be sat. Decided to just leave and eat somewhere else.The first time I went there the food was okay but we got there at 2:00 and waited 30 minutes for our food. They started flipping chairs and cleaning up around us even though they don't close until 3:30. Most likely will never return.

BEST breakfast place in west philly.

Food.....good home cooking meal, taste great, great portion size and.....best price.

A must order......Chicken and Waffles.  I've also been able to swap the waffles out for pancakes also.  Love that they are flexible like that.  

Their omelette are great also.  They come with a side of hash browns, which they also give a lot.

Pancakes are popular also.

Love that this is a mom and pop place.

I've been here many times and have had many meetings here.

Best place in West Philly, hands down. It's got everything you want a diner type place to have. Never had a bad meal here. They really care. Only place I regularly tip when I'm just getting takeout. And not for nothing but it's one of the only places I've ever seen in the city that has a truly diverse staff. Everybody kind of gets along. It's reflected in the food. Their chicken and waffle dish is a straight up Black and Asian fusion. Obviously 'Chicken & Waffles' is a southern Black thing but the chicken they serve here with the waffles is a spicy, crispy Chinese chicken. It's incredible and it definitely sets it apart, been going here for 7 years don't plan on stopping.

I've been here three times in the past month. That alone should say a lot about my feelings for Cedar Park Cafe. My 1st visit here, I went for breakfast with my sister and two nieces, at one of my nieces' recommendation. I loved how bright, airy, and clean the inside was. We had a happy bubbly server, and the food was hot and delicious. My 2nd visit was a to-go. Got a quick breakfast sandwich. Tasted great. No problems.

Prior to my most recent visit, I remembered my niece mentioning that their chicken and waffles were great. I made a mental note to return soon. Last week, I was in the area (well, sort of) for a coat drive that I volunteered at.  I went in around 1:45, and dined alone. Again, my server was friendly and I was seated near the window. I don't know if that window seat was good or bad, because I'm sure passers-by saw me making faces and dancing while I was eating. I'm sure some of you have smiled and danced in your seat while eating good food! That was some of the best chicken and waffles I've ever had!! 

Cedar Park Cafe has officially been added to the list of favorite neighborhood inexpensive breakfast spots.

As a contractor I eat out a lot for lunch. I saw the reviews and decided to try it out. As I sat down at the table I noticed how clean and fresh the dining looked. Then came the waitress Tawnya. All business and very efficient. She answered all the questions took our order and brought the food back so fast I thought she had roller skates on. The third time I went there I actually got her to laugh. I the food is excellent and the service was superb. A friend that was with me said she would being her grandchildren back for Sunday breakfast. Great find. Check it out.

Sunday morning in University City/West Philadelphia.  I was hungry and happy I ended up in front of Cedar Park Cafe.  I was really happy I kept reading the menu until I found the Danwich section.   A breakfast cheesesteak with eggs and hash browns. Everybody's on the good traditional roll together. I do wish everybody got mixed together on the grill but little bite discipline takes care of that.  $7.50, you know I love that.

Love this place so much and I'm so glad they were able to open back up. There are few things I appreciate more than a good, down-to-earth diner, and Cedar Park fits that perfectly. I have had their chicken and waffles, and agree with other reviewers that it's excellent. But my favorite thing to get is the #1 breakfast combo with eggs, home fries, sausage, and toast. It's definitely a lot of food and it's nothing fancy, but it doesn't need to be fancy because it's so freaking delicious. CP is also very reasonably priced which suits me just fine, and the folks who work there are friendly. Overall one of my favorite places to go out to eat in the city.

Pancakesssss! Their pancakes are the best I've ever had. They are fluffy, not too sweet, and the texture is just right. Their portions overall is decently sized and shareable. We usually do takeout, and call ahead, so I can't speak on the wait time to dine-in but it does get pretty crowded. This was a spot I had bookmarked for the longest, and randomly tried to one day, and I have been hooked ever since. 

Overall I would recommend!

The University City area has numerous food spots. This place gets pretty packed during brunch hours, especially on the weekends. As soon as you walk in, you feel a comforting, home-y vibe. There's an eclectic blend of people from hipsters to university students to families who are all coming together for a hearty and delicious meal at a great price. 

My girlfriend and I love brunch, and Cedar Park Cafe has become one of our favorites spots. Our normal order is Chicken and Waffles and the Dankwich, which we split and share. The chicken is fried to a nice crunch with a well-seasoned breading. The Dankwich has several options you can choose from, and it is basically a breakfast platter in a hoagie roll. It sounds questionable, but you won't regret ordering this. My girlfriend also really enjoys the Corn Beef Hash. 

Cedar Park Cafe is a staple of West Philadelphia as well as in our hearts.

We got there around 11am on a Saturday and only had to wait about 20 minutes. In terms of service, it's a solid 2 stars. Although they are friendly, they don't seem very attentive. They don't really talk to you or acknowledge your presence until they have a table ready for you. Once we were seated, we waited another 5 minutes to get the menu and then another 10 for someone to take our order. If you don't actively try to get a server's attention, they'll just walk by your table multiple times. That being said.. the food is delicious! The portion size leaves you full and it's very cheap! My breakfast platter (2 eggs, 4 pieces of bacon, 3 french toast) was only $8. I believe the owner was at the cash register and she was very friendly.

Found this "hole in the wall" cafe after arriving in Philadelphia. This was a local joint, there was no big line, everyone seemed to know everyone. It was great.

We were seated, and looking at the menu they did not have anything outrageous or crazy like larger breakfast places, which I liked. The coffee was hot and the servers were very friendly. I got the corned beef has. While it seemed like the kind you get out of a can, the amount that they gave you was amazing. Basically half of a large plate with two eggs on top, toast, and equal amount of hashbrowns for only 7.99. I usually eat all my breakfast (favorite meal) but couldn't this time. The person I was with had an omelette that was large and looked just as good. If I am ever in town again I will definitely be back.
Stumble upon this spot while hanging out in Philly, great little hole in the wall place to grab a hearty breakfast with great customer service too. Highly recommend it if you're in the area.

I visited this place for a Sunday brunch. The place is a bit small and busy on Sunday so you will probably be standing waiting by the door or outside. We were seated probably in 10mins. Our server Sapoea was pretty busy but she was still attentive. I order the platter with French toast. I enjoyed everything! There wasn't any wow factor, it tasted like straight  cookbook. This is basic affordable comfort food for days when you don't feel like cooking.

Woke up on a Sunday craving pancakes, turkey bacon, and scrambled eggs and didn't want to cook it....so I yelped, found this place and 30 minutes I was there waiting in line to get a seat aaaaand it was worth the wait! YUMMY food, great service, and reasonable prices...this is one of my new favorite places!!!!
Love this place. No frills breakfast spot that has all your classics and has great lunch options too. Friendly staff and great prices.

On any given Sunday morning, Cedar Park will have the most perfect mix of West Philadelphia that I can think of. Hipsters, families, old folks, students.... it's an interesting cross-section of the neighborhood.

Food-wise: probably my favorite no-frills breakfast in Philly! Heaping, throw-down portions, and perfect crispy home fries. Good stuff.

HOLY MOLY!! This is a must stop if you're visiting. The food was amazing, I'm not the biggest fan of pancakes, but these are a must. The atmosphere was great, the service was even better. I'd had never heard of scrapple so immediately I was enticed. So glad I chose it. The omelette smelled, tasted , and looked so amazing. And my dankwhich was on point!!! Super happy I'm going to be able to come more often now that I've moved to Philadelphia!

This is good, basic, inexpensive breakfast. The food and service has always been consistent. It is definitely no frills, but it's clean with a bright atmosphere and the food is more than solid. I've never had a bad meal or experience here. I love their home fries and pancakes especially. My one gripe is the use of the fake butter/country crock spread. Real butter please!

Love the food and the fact that this is a sit down eatery in the community. The service is always great from the wait staff to check out. For those who don't eat meat they have delicious salmon cakes. I normally over do it with pancakes eggs salmon cakes and veggie home fries (Sleep please)  Must go!

So my kids and I decided on trying this place out. My daughter and I ordered the #9, which is a two meat combo with grits, home fries, eggs and toast.  Food came out fast and everything tasted fresh.  Service was great too.  My son ordered the chicken Caesar wrap for breakfast!  He loved it!  Definitely a return visit.
Ate here with my family in 2017 and can't wait to be able to eat here again! The chick and waffles are the best I have ever eaten!

Cedar Park Cafe is a solid neighbourhood brunch spot.  It's simple food at a good price.

We've gone for brunch a few times & my fave dish is the veggie home fries, which are nicely fried up potatoes with fried onions and green pepper.   I've also tasted the corned beef hash and creamed chipped beef, both of which are good.  Things I did not enjoy were the fish (dry, overcooked, flavourless) and poached eggs (rubbery).

Service is good.  I like how our waitress will call us things like "sweetie" and "darling" -- it adds to the charm of brunch.

3.5 stars

Cedar Park Cafe is still my favourite neighbourhood brunch spot.  I always order the veggie home fries, well done, so that the potatoes are crispy. The potatoes are fried with vegetables like onions, green pepper, spinach, broccoli, and tomato.

The tofu vegetable scramble is another solid choice if you like veggies, but want some extra protein in there.

I've previously tried the corned beef hash (solid), creamed chipped beef (fine), fish (dry, overcooked, flavourless) and poached eggs (rubbery).

Service is good.

I meant to update this review before the pandemic. My last visit (pre-pandemic) was not as good as some of my earlier experiences.

One thing I didn't like is that it seemed like the staff was upselling and upcharging without making clear that certain items cost more. For example, I ordered home fries & they asked "onions and peppers?" like they're a regular part of the dish. However, there's an extra charge for at least one of those (peppers I think?). It's not a ton of $$, but I'd like it if it were more clearly communicated what was included and what was not. Same thing happened with a particular cheese that was offered and chosen for a sandwich; apparently it cost extra but I didn't know that until I saw it on the bill.

Here's the food report card, I use ^ to indicate a half-star and * for a full star. So, ***^ means 3.5 stars:

****^ Bacon grilled cheese sandwich is very good

**** Veggie home fries are great, especially when they're well done with crispy potatoes

*** Tofu vegetable scramble is solid if you like veggies, but want some extra protein in there

*** Corned beef hash is solid

** Dankwich was not good, it had home fries in it & was all carbs, with pretty much no flavour

Previously, I've also tried the creamed chipped beef (fine), fish (dry,  overcooked, flavourless) and poached eggs (rubbery).

Although this place gets packed, they are quick to seat and serve you. If you don't like lines, try and come as early as possible for breakfast. It's such a great neighborhood spot with great selections, service, and food. Although the menu looks typical, the food is delicious and the portion sizes are large.

went here wit the hubs from breakfast one day bc of the yelp reviews. very good good. friendly staff. typical breakfast/lunch dinner. its in an "up and comming" area of west philly. will return next time we are down there.

Extremely fast service.  Cleanest diner I've ever seen.  Friendly staff.  Waittress saved me a buck by better explaining the breakfast special menu.  Not too expensive.   Great little breakfast place.

Just visited because I was in the area and Yelp had it ranked. I was not disappointed. The young lady who waited on us was very polite and attentive (although extremely busy).... I ordered the California Omelette and my lady had the fried whiting and grits.... We were both very pleased and will now go out of our way to return. One caveat.... No off street parking so you may have to walk a bit.... Worth it!

So my family and I walked in for lunch and realized that they closed in 30 minutes! We started to think about going somewhere else and the kind waitress told us to sit down and she's serve us. The people here are so nice and I hope other people have the same experience as us!

We were visiting the Philadelphia area and looking for breakfast but having no luck. I found Cedar Park Cafe here on Yelp. The neighborhood looked iffy and it was hard to find a parking spot. However we were glad we persevered. The food was well priced, service excellent, really yummy. Our waitress, Janaya, couldn't have been nicer or more efficient.

While visiting friends in Philly, they insisted we go here for Saturday brunch and raved about it the whole previous day. I'm happy to say that they did not exaggerate! 

We went around noon on Sat, so it was pretty busy and there wasn't much room for our group of six. However, a lovely couple saw our dilemma and offered to move so we could sit at the more accommodating center tables. That basically sums up the demographic here; everyone is so neighborly! We had a great conversation with the family sitting next to us while we waited for our food.

Speaking of the food, it was awesome! I got the #10, which came with beef bacon, two eggs, and three french toast. I couldn't even finish it all! I was curious about the beef bacon, which ended up tasting pretty similar to pork bacon (aka delicious). It was cooked nice and crispy. While I don't normally put butter on my french toast, it came with butter already on it and was so nice and melty that I may have to change my ways. Perfectly golden and fluffy. It was a great deal for about $8. 

Our server Faye was sweet and attentive, and I speak for everyone when I say this visit MADE our Saturday morning. Everyone enjoyed their meal to the max. Looking forward to stopping by by next time I'm in town!

Okay so since my last visit I have fell in love with this place. I've only been here about 7 times since the first review and I'm a regular. Great service, great food and on busy days it's worth the wait to be seated.
